metadata.name: Out—Land #85
metadata.description:
Nowhere but here, before—a prequel, of sorts,
with nothing yet built to fall;
a jagged canvas,
unowned, unknown…
brutal even if naive

——

A : Animate rendering
S : Save at 2000x2500 pixels
1 -> 5 : Save 3000x3750 -> 7000x8750
(incrementing width 1000 pixels with each step)

We colonize our world reducing it into small divided spaces that we are dying to own: A Place To Live

Press [S] to save an image of the canvas in a resolution of 4000x4000 pixels

Artist: Estienne
July 2022
License NFT 2.0

metadata.name: Snell's Artifacts #97
metadata.description:
Snell's artifacts are imaginary geometric objects created using Snell's and Descartes' laws of optics that define the behavior of a ray of light passing from one transparent medium to another.

By applying these laws to extreme parameters, beyond what the real world is capable of producing and with a high level of variability, we open the door to a new world.

In order to keep some control over this extreme and crazy world, the grid within which the rays evolve is divided into several squares. Each of these squares limits the grid settings at that location.

In order to be able to generate a Snell Artifact, 1 to 6 million rays are created. It may take a while. So be patient while these radii are calculated.




Keyboard commands:
[S]: Saves a PNG image of 4000x4000 pixels without glow filter
[SHIFT + S]: Saves a 4000x4000 pixel PNG image and applies a glow filter (may take a long time depending on your system)

URL parameters:
Add the parameter size=N to generate an image of NxN pixels (glow effect will be disabled by default)
Add the parameter glow=true to apply a glow effect to the image




Artist: Estienne
July 2022

metadata.name: GEN XYZ Das Occult #6753
metadata.description:
A 10k Generative Profile Pic collection
GEN XYZ Das Occult - by culla - @tamccullough

move over cryptopunks
there is a new group on the scene

100% code - not an image composition

A bunch of common palettes
A selection of rare palettes
And a smaller set of ultra rare palettes
However, rarity will be based on what combinations the code produces

The majority of tokens will not have a special trait
However your token might have one or even multiple special traits
But, be aware that only the last special trait added will be listed in the features

Even then, look closely, because not all aspects of the canvas are included in the features. Collectors should still look closely and choose what they like when buying on secondary.

Which team are you on? X or O?

follow culla on twitter for updates. Or maybe __acolyte__

If the non reserved tokens mint out quickly, Access List mints will have 24 hours to mint reserves assigned to those wallets

Thank you for supporting an emerging artist in the generative art space

Access List reserves were given to holders of the following PFP collections created by culla
2x for each Basqunk held
1x for each Inkspunk, TwoFourQunk, V0iD, DeeManz, Punkasso and CR0$$KULL
You would have needed to transfer the above tokens to your mint wallet at the time of the snapshot

share your tokens on social media with #genxyznft
Made with love by culla using p5.js

metadata.name: Euphonic #1076
metadata.description:
Euphonic is an exploration of the emergent visual properties that arise from placing layers of simple lines atop one another.

In general this effect is called the Moiré effect. This effect really feels best in the tactile - when you have a printed page and an acetate sheet. This piece attempts to recreate that tactile joy.

This is built in WebGL 2 and so doesn't work in Safari 14 and below. All latest browsers will work as expected.

Licensing: BY-NC-ND see license.md for details.

metadata.name: Poems in the Public Domain #15
metadata.description:
POEMS IN THE PUBLIC DOMAIN [PITPD] represents a new form of poetic anthology—one that celebrates the role of the reader in shaping the life of a poem. In this unique art piece, 14 readers take turns discovering 30 classic poems. We invite collectors to explore this compendium, selected to present a diverse, engaging archive that acknowledges the importance of certain seminal works in shaping our collective unconscious. 

Inspired by Roland Barthe's maxim, "those who fail to reread are obliged to read the same story everywhere," each reader is represented by multiple pen colors & new marginalia, suggesting the crucial act of rereading. 

The verses vanish, just like our memory of their exact words might fade, but distilled, standout moments of personal connection remain. In time, even these wane, providing a scarcely perceptible backdrop as the poem is discovered & interpreted anew. 

PITPD explores authorship. When a poem enters the public domain, it no longer belongs to its author but to its readers. In the intimate moments we read a poem, we link it to our private, pulsating worlds & help ensure others will read it, too. If history’s palms hadn’t held Sappho’s words, our fingers wouldn’t hold them now. 

Readers write poetry’s survival. 

Each iteration of PITPD traces a narrative that can play for hours without repeating. Some 89% of iterations chronicle the life of a single poem, while 11% include multiple poems, intentionally surveying intertextuality. Taking advantage of the generative medium, embodied readership is represented via dynamic handwriting, dancing markings, algorithmic paper aging, coded stains, & other effects.

Spacebar pauses & resumes the animation. Refreshing the browser window restarts it. For those interested in the underlying code, please open the browser console. This collection’s ciphers, too, are in the public domain.

Additional information can be found in the companion article on fx(text): fxhash.xyz/article/poems-in-the-public-domain-marginalia-as-living-verse

attributes.name: Poem
attributes.value: Baghavad Gita, Excerpt from Chapter VI

metadata.name: Amara Celestial #102
metadata.description:
The universe is terrifyingly vast, mostly pitch-dark, save some billions of trillions of stars and planets. We are nothing. In all that vastness, we are the smallest fraction of time imaginable, floating around on a speck of dust. Yet somehow, we continue to work, learn, build relationships, create, and participate in all these other odd, uniquely human practices. It’s truly fascinating, when in the grand scheme, none of it seems consequential.

Amara Celestial is an artistic representation of this intergalactic madness and the love for it. To expand on the project’s identity…Amara, my wife’s name, has many meanings. In her culture and family, it means “love” or “everlasting beauty”. Celestial most commonly refers to things not of this world, but from the sky, or space. The shapes, lines, and primary design of this project represent the unpredictable nature of the universe. The entire piece is stippled with thousands of points of various palette selected colors, to resemble the uncountable number of light sources in the great sea of space, as well as to provide textural depth.

The Features:
- Canvas Style: Pretty simple, the canvas can be square (2048 x 2048), portrait (1352 X 2048) or landscape (2048 x 1352).
- Palettes: There are 10 different palettes, each with equal chance of being randomly chosen. The palettes were heavily influenced by my wife. She is a woman of South American descent and loves the bright colors and contrast often seen in the traditional clothing and art of her culture. There are a few muted palettes, including a mono palette to mix things up!
- Background Color: The background color can be black, white, or blue with varying rarity.
- Background Noise: This controls the level of turbulence in the background shape (if drawn).
- Primary Noise: This controls the level of turbulence in the primary shape (i.e., the foremost shape).
- Secondary Noise: This controls the level of turbulence in the secondary shape.
- Posterize: This is a color limiting filter that can cause harsher (less smooth) changes in color. The lower the number, the more abrupt the changes (2 being the lowest allowed).
- Primary Shape Centered: This is a true/false based on whether the primary shape is centered on the canvas.
- Background override: This will override the selected background and replace it with vertical or horizontal lines, or prevent the background shape from being drawn entirely.

Other randomness factors (non-features)
- Stroke thickness on various shapes and points of the project.
- Size of the overall shapes, as well as the size of the inner radius of the shapes.
- Spacing between the stippling and lines (to keep it pattern-less).
- Positioning of all the shapes (restricted to the canvas).
- The number of iterations (rings) for each shape.

metadata.name: Sezioni #46
metadata.description:
Noise controlled painting with p5.js

Possible rarities:
- Dark Background
- Monochrome

metadata.name: September #267
metadata.description:
The Summer Ends
---------------
Controls:
S or double tap (mobile): Download image

A: Toggle loading animation (off by default to improve performance)

1-6: Modify scale (1 = default, 1500 x 2000px, 6 = maximum, 9000 x 12000px (performance intensive, will take a long time to render))
F: Fit to current screen size

T: Toggle grain and texture overlay
H: Toggle shape outlines

B: Cycle border sizes (0 -> 50 -> 75 -> 100 -> 150px)
C: Cycle border colors

I: Cycle visible layers

L: Toggle “live mode”. This mode will continuously redraw a new output every few seconds using the same base parameters as the original output, but with slight variations.

You can modify the x and y url parameters to set a custom size. Note that the image will change to fit the new size, but overall drawing style, colors, etc. will remain the same.
(For example, for a 1000x2000 image, add &x=1000&y=2000)
---------------
teaboswell 2022
CC BY-NC-ND 4.0, See bundle.js.LICENSE.txt for third party license information
10% of primary sales will be donated to Girls Who Code (https://girlswhocode.com)

metadata.name: BlockTrain Object #12
metadata.description:
It’s a material that can be seen and touched.
You can combine it as you want.
Like a puzzle, we need to group them
We’ll hear the melody when we merge it.


https://blocktrain.art


💻：
Press 's' to save png.
Press 'i' to view information.
📱：

metadata.name: Towers of Power #1
metadata.description:
In this generative art illustration, I wanted to represent the power of the upper class against as tall towers against and covering a starred sky. 
I sketched the towers with vertical and horizontal lines, circles, and ellipses to represent the power and control that they have. 
A light, transparent and, yet big, sun is sketched in the background to represent the hope that the poor and minorities have for justice and a better world.

This illustration is created within my research effort to recreate in the digital medium my style of physical acrylic painting that uses paint drips on technical drawings and textured background.

Three modes: dark, light and gold.
Many form factors.

Hit 's' to save a svg
Hit 'p' to save a png

metadata.name: Under a New Sky #162
metadata.description: They surveyed countless planets for an ecosystem that would suit their needs.

metadata.name: Plottable Thousands #88
metadata.description:
'Thousands' explores the packing of recursive circles and golden angle spirals distributing various particles on a A4 canvas.

A SVG file can be exported (right click save) to plot the piece physically.

You can enjoy the digital version that simulate ink effects and optional, thanks to the utility token decoupling, get a physical one: the digital NFT is the recipe to a plottable art piece, owning it confers the right to plot or request a physical plot from @greweb (https://greweb.me/plots/nft). @greweb would use fountain pens but other plotting artists are free to achieve it with their own materials and ship to collectors – as long as NFT is owned at request time.

Code: https://github.com/gre/gre/tree/master/doodles/plottable-thousands

@greweb – 2022 – tech: WebGL + Rust + WASM – CC BY-SA 4.0 https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/

metadata.name: Traffic #83
metadata.description:
Traffic is a companion piece to Scaffold. Whilst Scaffold was intended to capture a moment in time of a single mind, Traffic aims to represent a shared moment in a community.

Outputs can be beautiful, but can also be chaotic. They can be comprised of many contributions, but a single voice may drown out many others.

All royalties go to the original minter.

Keyboard commands:

s - save as png
h - toggle high resolution 
b - toggle background texture
a - switch aspect ratio
r - new moment

metadata.name: Contort #28
metadata.description:
Contort is the result of combining several previously meaningless experiments and learnings into a single cohesive algorithm. The project comes in a variety of shapes, bends, twists, colors, and other variations.  

The artwork builds towards the end-result by rendering a fixed number of forms per frame to ensure a smooth rendering process. Rendering times can vary depending on which features are combined by the hash.
